posts.name: Yahya Burak
posts.cooked: We use yagsl for our swerve drive and for imu there is navx2mxp on roborio.Everyone says “roborio and imu have to be center of the robot” yes ofc but are there any physical issues if we put it a bit far of the center like 10-15 centimeters?

posts.name: Andrew Card
posts.cooked: The roborio can be placed anywhere. IMUs should be as centered as is convenient. If its not right on center its not the end of the world. If your IMU is the navx mounted directly on the rio then the rio probably should be closeish to the middle. But again its not the end of the world being off

posts.name: Yahya Burak
posts.cooked: Thanks for the answer, but another thing I’m wondering about is if we move the Roborio 15 centimeters from the center are there and big differences in drive?  (we’re planning to put the system right in the middle this year so roborio should have 2 positions,inverted in bottom or move a bit from normal center)

posts.name: 4573 Lead Mentor & Drive Coach
posts.cooked: It should not be a huge deal, there’s a bunch of threads about it. If you’re using a pigeon you can actually mount it vertically to save space but make sure to recalibrate it. For a Navx keeping it flat is nicer since those seem to be more finicky (personal experience).

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
One of those threads mentioned above references the CTRE Pigeon manual. It outlines how to test for inaccuracies. It looks like it applies to any IMU so you can test your NavX with the procedure. The gyro doesn’t care much about the center of rotation but the accelerometers do care. I don’t know if the NavX uses the sensor fusion like the Pigeon.

1317.03 KB

“2.1. Location – Center of Rotation” Also be mindful of “2.2. Temperature”

posts.name: 4573 Lead Mentor & Drive Coach
posts.cooked: Alternatively you can use a ribbon cable to extend the navx to center that and then have the rip offset. It does add additional wires but can be useful

posts.name: Logan Bachman
posts.cooked: In 2023 my previous team put our RIO far off to the side of the robot with our navx on top and we had zero issues with it, no code changes required.

posts.name: Yahya Burak
posts.cooked: so even put further,there ıs also no issue on move a bit like 15 20cm

posts.name: Logan Bachman
posts.cooked:
Correct. image 640×640 59.5 KB Image of our 2023 robot, this side has the PDH but the RIO is just flipped on the other side of the robot.

image 640×640 59.5 KB

image 640×640 59.5 KB

posts.name: Yahya Burak
posts.cooked: ı thought there is big difference but there aren’t.So cool!
